system_message: You are an expert in liquid handling optimization using AGGRESSIVE EXPLORATION strategies. Analyze experimental pipetting data and recommend DIVERSE parameter improvements that explore different trade-off regions.
CRITICAL PARAMETER NOTE: For aspirate and dispense speed parameters (aspirate_speed, dispense_speed), HIGHER VALUES = SLOWER SPEEDS. This is counterintuitive but important for your analysis.
1. SPEED-FOCUSED: Test faster cycles (low wait times, fast speeds) - accept some accuracy trade-offs
2. ACCURACY-FOCUSED: Optimize for lowest deviation/variability - accept some time increase
3. PARETO FRONT: The most interesting results are along the Pareto front balancing deviation and time - explore this trade-off
4. UNEXPLORED REGIONS: Test parameter combinations in gaps/corners of the parameter space
1. EXAMINE THE DATA: Identify patterns across ALL three metrics (deviation, variability, time)
2. IDENTIFY GAPS: What parameter regions are UNEXPLORED in your dataset?
3. EMBRACE TRADE-OFFS: Test different optimization priorities - don't just seek safe middle ground
4. DIVERSIFY RECOMMENDATIONS: Each of your multiple suggestions should explore different hypotheses/regions
5. REFERENCE DATA: Cite specific experimental results in your reasoning
REMEMBER: The goal is systematic exploration of the trade-off space, not just incremental improvement!

aspirate_speed.description: Speed for liquid aspiration operations. IMPORTANT: Higher values = SLOWER speed. Lower values = faster speed. Slower speeds (higher values) may improve accuracy but increase time.

dispense_speed.description: Speed for liquid dispensing operations. IMPORTANT: Higher values = SLOWER speed. Lower values = faster speed. Slower speeds (higher values) may improve accuracy but increase time.

aspirate_wait_time.description: Wait time after aspiration before tip movement. Longer wait times may improve accuracy/reduce deviation by allowing liquid to settle, but increase total time.

dispense_wait_time.description: Wait time after dispensing before tip movement. Longer wait times may improve accuracy/reduce deviation by ensuring complete dispensing, but increase total time.

retract_speed.description: Speed for retracting tip from liquid surface. Higher values = faster retraction, lower values = slower retraction. Slower retractions may improve accuracy.

blowout_vol.description: Air volume blown out after dispensing to ensure complete liquid transfer and reduce retention.

post_asp_air_vol.description: Air volume aspirated after liquid to prevent dripping.

overaspirate_vol.description: Extra volume aspirated beyond target to compensate for retention. Needed when the pipette tip retains some liquid after aspiration.

deviation.description: Accuracy metric - deviation from expected mass
deviation.exploration_note: In speed-focused recommendations, moderate increases acceptable for significant time reduction

variability.description: Precision metric - standard deviation across replicates
variability.exploration_note: In speed-focused recommendations, some precision trade-off acceptable

time.description: Efficiency metric - total operation time per pipetting cycle
time.exploration_note: Important for speed-focused recommendations, secondary for accuracy-focused ones

glycerol.description: High viscosity liquid with strong hydrogen bonding
glycerol.optimization_notes: Use slower flow rates and longer settling times due to high viscosity. Consider increased air volumes.

water.optimization_notes: Standard reference for pipetting parameters. Moderate flow rates work well.
